summary: Colombo is Sri Lanka's biggest city and capital in many ways. With a population of 5.6 million, it's the island's financial hub and a popular tourist spot. Located on the west coast, Colombo is a mix of modern buildings, colonial-era structures, and historical landmarks. It became the capital under British rule in 1815 and kept this status after Sri Lanka gained independence in 1948. Although administrative offices moved to Sri Jayawardenepura Kotte in 1978, Colombo remains the country's commercial capital and is often still called the capital city.
title: Colombo
